answerText: focal length [or f][10] In a spherical lens, this aberrations occurs because different wavelengths of light are refracted differently. It occurs in transverse and axial varieties.
heading: VCU Closed  |2013 | Columbia A + Ottawa  | 20 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions about spherical lenses, for 10 points each: [10] For a spherical lens, this value is equal to one-half times the radius of curvature. It is the distance from the lens at which an image is produced when the object is placed at infinity.
